news_header: The US has grounded SpaceX's Starship rocket after an explosion during a test flight, prompting an investigation.
news_original_title: US grounds SpaceX's Starship after test flight explosion
news_text: The US has grounded SpaceX's Starship rocket following an explosion during its latest test flight over the Caribbean. The FAA is investigating the incident and has activated a debris response area. Elon Musk's company is required to conduct a 'mishap' investigation. The Starship, the largest rocket ever built, aims to support Musk's goal of colonizing Mars. The recent flight was the seventh test mission and involved a new upgraded version of the rocket. Despite the incident, Musk indicated that the next launch could still occur next month.
